body_content.explanation: abbreviation for high-occupancy toll lane: a fast-moving lane (= a section) on a wide road that is only to be used by cars with two or more people in them, by buses, or by vehicles with only a driver if the driver pays a toll (= a charge):
examples: The HOT lanes are designed primarily for express buses and other high-occupancy vehicles.
Over the course of the month, 6,500 different vehicles used the HOT lanes.
